Back:
1. Memorize Qur’an weekly 📖
  • 🌍 Foundation: Quran: “Recite in the name of your Lord...” (al-‘Alaq 96:1) — door to manhood.
  • 🙏 Safeguard: Hadith: “Retain... Qur’an... escapes sooner than a camel...” (Bukhari) — don’t neglect.
  • 💡 Properly: Consult reciter—avoid butchering short surahs (e.g., three Quls).

2. Get in shape 💪
  • 🏃 Health: Hadith: “Two blessings... health and free time” (Bukhari) — fitness is key.
  • ⚖️ Strong believer: Hadith: “The strong believer is better...” (Muslim) — Allah loves it.
  • 🩺 Obligation: Yearly check-up, jog, push-ups—balance mind and body.

3. Avoid unhealthy foods 🍎
  • 🚫 Harm: Quran: “Eat from the good things... do not transgress...” (Ta Ha 20:81) — pure over junk.
  • 🍯 Prophet’s way: Loved honey, organic—not sugary excess (‘Umar’s fear).
  • 💡 Character: You become what you eat—avoid fat, sugar traps.

4. Grow your beard 🧔
  • 📜 Command: Hadith: “Trim your moustaches, let your beards grow” (Bukhari) — no option.
  • 🙏 Sunnah’s weight: Hadith: “Follow my Sunnah...” (at-Tirmidhi); Quran: “If you love Allah, follow me...” (Al ‘Imran 3:31) — salvation, not “just sunnah.”
  • 💪 Identity: Shows confidence in Islam—don’t shave for others.

5. Be tolerant 🤝
  • 🌟 Blessing: Hadith: “I have not been sent to curse but to be a blessing” (Muslim); Quran: “We have not sent you except as a mercy...” (al-Anbiya’ 21:107) — reflect this.
  • 🕊️ Security: Hadith: “A true believer... others feel secure” (Bukhari); stood for Jewish funeral (Muslim) — respect all.
  • 💡 No bigotry: Tolerance isn’t compromise—learn from history, experience.

6. Tell the truth 🗣️
  • 📜 Justice: Quran: “Fear Allah and speak words of appropriate justice” (al-Ahzab 33:70) — liars are cowards.
  • 🙏 Record: Hadith: “Keeps on telling the truth... recorded among the truthful” (Bukhari) — builds honor.
  • 💡 Courage: No respect for liars—truth sets men apart.

7. Fulfil promises and debts 🤝
  • 📜 Contracts: Quran: “Fulfil [all] contracts...” (al-Ma’idah 5:1); “He imposes blame... what your hearts have earned” (al-Baqarah 2:225) — keep your word.
  • 💰 Debt: Record loans, repay fast—honesty if late, no hiding.
  • 💪 Integrity: Broken promises lose respect—be reliable.

8. Be brave ⚔️
  • 🌟 Justice: Quran: “Never will fleeing benefit you...” (al-Ahzab 33:16) — face danger for truth.
  • 🙏 Balance: Avoid fights, apologize first—not aggressor or coward.
  • 💡 Taqwa: Brave for Allah, not ego—trust Him, don’t run.

9. Keep a secret 🤫
  • 📜 Justice: Quran: “Be... witnesses for Allah, even if against yourselves...” (an-Nisa’ 4:135) — report harm, else stay silent.
  • 🙏 Trust: Hadith: “Allah will hide the sins of anyone who hid...” (Bukhari); tale-carriers punished (Bukhari) — no gossip.
  • 💡 Honor: Betrayal kills trust—guard others’ confidence.

10. Be serious and noble 😊
  • 🌟 Dignity: Hadith: “If you knew what I know, you would laugh less...” (Bukhari) — control laughter.
  • 🤝 Balance: Smile, chuckle—don’t overdo jest or grumpiness.
  • 💪 Respect: No rough play unless mutual—stay composed.

11. Be shy before Allah 🙈
  • 📜 Modesty: Quran: “Do not approach immoralities...” (al-An‘am 6:151); Hadith: “If you have no shame...” (Bukhari) — avoid sin.
  • 🙏 Mercy: Hadith: “A servant committed a sin... I have forgiven you” (Muslim) — hope for the weak.
  • 💡 Growth: Shun bars, explicit media—angels shy too.
Back

12. Volunteer 🤝
  • 🌟 Respect: Quran: “...And cooperate in righteousness and piety...” (al-Ma’idah 5:2) — earns honor.
  • 💪 Camaraderie: Help all—builds friendships, uses time well.
  • 🙏 Sincerity: Serve people to please Allah—shovel snow, improve lives.

13. Do not be loud 🤫
  • 🚫 Civility: Quran: “...the most disagreeable of sounds is the voice of donkeys” (Luqman 31:19) — stay polite.
  • 😊 Prophet’s way: Hadith: Smiled at rude Bedouin (Bukhari) — calm, not screams.
  • 💡 Control: Hadith: “Do not become angry” (Bukhari) — shouting shows weakness.

14. Practise your Arabic reading and writing 📜
  • 🌍 Qur’an’s key: Unlock meanings—don’t rely on translations.
  • 🙏 Reward: Hadith: “Whoever stumbles through the Qur’an... double reward” (Muslim) — even alif-ba’ counts.
  • 💡 Depth: Full knowledge needs Arabic—don’t miss out.

15. Do not stand with oppression and oppressors ⚖️
  • 📜 Justice: Quran: “...be persistently standing firm for Allah, witnesses in justice...” (al-Ma’idah 5:8) — truth over friends.
  • 🤝 Advise: Hadith: “Help your brother... advise him” (Bukhari) — correct, don’t defend wrong.
  • 💡 Neutrality: Stay aloof—don’t side with lies for loyalty.

16. Honour women 👩
  • 🌟 Best: Hadith: “The best of you are those who are best to their families...” (at-Tirmidhi) — kindness to wife, mom, daughters.
  • 💪 Leadership: Protect, honor their intellect, patience—Eve’s purpose (Ibn Katheer).
  • 🙏 Balance: Compliment, be patient—lead, don’t control.

17. If a task is assigned to you, do it excellently 🛠️
  • 📜 Fairness: Quran: “Woe to those who give less [than due]...” (al-Mutaffifeen 83:1-3) — don’t short-change.
  • 💪 Humility: Prophets shepherded, Muhammad (ﷺ) built—do all well.
  • 🌟 Reflection: Work shows you—sweep or sew excellently.

18. Give charity in secret 🤲
  • 🙏 Effort: Hadith: “...left hand does not know what the right hand has given” (Bukhari) — even 50 cents counts.
  • 💡 Purity: Don’t steal deeds from yourself—share wealth.
  • 🌟 Allah sees: He rewards your hidden good—don’t flaunt.

19. Abandon foul speech 🗣️
  • 🌟 Dignity: Hadith: “Whoever imitates a people is from them” (Abu Dawood) — avoid slang, curses.
  • 💡 Clarity: Speak upright—Satan makes foul fashionable.
  • 🙏 Middle path: Don’t overdo vocab or laxity—be clear.

20. Treat people equally ⚖️
  • 🌟 Prophet’s way: Hadith: “Spread the greetings of peace” (Muslim); full attention to all (Muslim) — no favoritism.
  • 🙏 Chivalry: Hadith: “I do not shake hands with unfamiliar women” (Ibn Majah) — respect, not long gazes.
  • 📜 Justice: Quran: “As for he who thinks himself without need...” (‘Abasa 80:5-11) — equal care.

21. Save money for emergencies 💰
  • 📜 Spend: Quran: “...spend out of what We have provided...” (al-Baqarah 2:3) — save for need.
  • 💪 Responsibility: Be an asset—$10/month for Hajj, funerals.
  • 🌟 Balance: Don’t hoard absurdly—help in crises.

22. Talk to your Lord 🤲
  • 📜 Relief: Quran: “...by the remembrance of Allah, hearts are assured” (ar-Ra‘d 13:28); “...seek help through patience and prayer” (al-Baqarah 2:153) — dhikr heals.
  • 🙏 Prophet’s way: Hadith: “I seek forgiveness... seventy times a day” (Bukhari) — constant supplication.
  • 💡 Weapon: Strong faith cuts mountains—call Allah always.

Front: 23. Why pray five prayers in congregation? 🕌
Back:
23. Strive to pray your five prayers in congregation 🕌
  • 🌟 Merit: Hadith: “Prayer in congregation is twenty-seven times more meritorious...” (Bukhari) — huge reward.
  • 🙏 Focus: Go to mosque, don’t loiter—feed your soul, not just stomach.
  • 💡 Purpose: Avoid social club vibe or imam dislike—prioritize worship.

24. Respect leadership 👑
  • 📜 Obey: Quran: “Obey Allah and obey the Messenger and those in authority...” (an-Nisa’ 4:59) — unity’s root.
  • 🤝 Advise: Counsel privately, not publicly—‘Ali’s lesson on followers.
  • 💪 Support: Don’t just criticize—help leaders, be a good soldier first.

Front: 25. Why be a good guest and host? 🍽️
Back:
25. Be a good guest and a good host 🍽️
  • 🌟 Honor: Hadith: “He who believes in Allah... should honour his guest” (Bukhari) — manners matter.
  • 🙏 Courtesy: Hadith: “Let only the righteous eat your food” (Abu Dawood) — patience as guest, generosity as host.
  • 💡 Character: Stay calm, don’t peek—earn second invites.

Front: 26. Why take care of your family? 👨‍👩‍👧
Back:
26. Take care of your family 👨‍👩‍👧
  • 📜 Tranquility: Quran: “He created for you mates... affection and mercy” (ar-Room 30:21) — bond with wife, kids.
  • 🌟 Prophet’s way: Hadith: Raced ‘A’ishah, no mercy in heart if not kind (Muslim) — play, don’t be an ogre.
  • 💪 Balance: Tough outside, soft at home—true manliness.

27. Give gifts 🎁
  • 🌟 Love: Hadith: “Give gifts to one another, and you will love one another” (Bukhari) — softens hearts.
  • 🙏 Upper hand: Hadith: “The upper hand is better than the lower hand” (Muslim) — giving exalts.
  • 💡 Gratitude: Small gifts (gloves, pen)—show Allah’s bounty.

28. Be mindful of excessive mixed-gender interaction 🚻
  • 📜 Modesty: Quran: “Tell the believing men to reduce their vision...” (an-Noor 24:30); “...tell the believing women...” (an-Noor 24:31) — protect both.
  • 🙏 Guard: Quran: “Righteous women... guarding in absence...” (an-Nisa’ 4:34) — avoid affair risks.
  • 💡 Intellect: Tawakkul Karman—modesty is civilization, not oppression.

Front: 29. Why cry in front of Allah? 😢
Back:
29. Cry in front of Allah 😢
  • 🌟 Shade: Hadith: “Among those shaded... a man who shed a tear for Allah” (Bukhari) — manliness in tears.
  • 📜 Fear: Quran: “Skins shiver... hearts relax at Allah’s remembrance” (az-Zumar 39:23) — feel death’s weight.
  • 💡 Remorse: Cry at funerals—50% for them, 50% for you.

30. Fast 🍽️
  • 📜 Righteousness: Quran: “Decreed upon you is fasting... that you may become righteous” (al-Baqarah 2:183) — discipline.
  • 🙏 Enough: Hadith: “A few morsels... are sufficient” (at-Tirmidhi) — curb overeating.
  • 💡 Gratitude: Three days monthly—value Allah’s blessings.

31. Never engage in backbiting or allow it 🤐
  • 📜 Caution: Quran: “Investigate, lest you harm... out of ignorance” (al-Hujurat 49:6) — ruins lives.
  • 💪 Character: Backbiters are fragile, jealous—listeners weak.
  • 🙏 Stop it: Warn cordially—fear Allah, shun gossipers.

Front: 32. Why remain silent and not brag? 🤫
Back:
32. Remain silent, and do not brag 🤫
  • 📜 Vanity: Quran: “Life of this world... boasting to one another...” (al-Hadeed 57:20) — avoid evil eye.
  • 🌟 Pride: Hadith: “Pride is looking down on people” (Muslim) — silence earns respect.
  • 💡 Modesty: Don’t flaunt wealth, kids—pious avoid braggarts.

33. Do not eat, wear, drive, or live in anything too luxurious 🚗
  • 📜 Waste: Quran: “The wasteful are brothers of the devils...” (al-Isra’ 17:27) — moderation, not excess.
  • 🙏 Prophet’s tears: Hadith: “We will be questioned about this meal...” (Bukhari) — simple meal moved him.
  • 💡 Balance: Live moderately—avoid spoiling family.
